_header: Alas poor man what chance have I

OxfBal316B.First Lines:
Alas poor man what chans havyþat must for bar whom y love
                    besty trow yt be my desteny…
OxfBal316B.Last Lines:
…Soo wold yow say in yowr good harteyff that suches payns yow
                    ded in dewr
OxfBal316B.Note:
Added to flyleaf at end by a later hand of the fifteenth or sixteenth
                    centuries; followed by another line of English, ‘Trv lool[?] vetew &
                    tru loue kyepe…’, possibly beginning of a third stanza.
OxfBal316B.Editions:
Mynors,  Roger Aubrey Baskerville,
                        ed.  
             Catalogue of Manuscripts in Balliol College Library.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1962: 334.
